title: Peter Dinklage gets a little height prop on the set of Rememory
title_page: Peter Dinklage gets a little height prop on the set of Rememory | Daily Mail Online
text:
He's certainly the biggest name in the film.
But when it came to this shot, Peter Dinklage needed an extra boost to see eye-to-eye with his co-star.
The 46-year-old was spotted on the set of his latest film Rememory in the Gastown District of Vancouver on Thursday.
Stepping up: Peter Dinklage got a little height boost from an apple box on the set of Rememory on Thursday
As he framed an external scene with a female co-star on a set of stairs, the production team utilised the ubiquitous apple box to create a less neck-craning two-shot.
Wearing black boots and jeans, a dark plaid coat and a purple patterned shirt, the actor bore a concerned look as the blonde recited her lines.
While it will just look like a normal conversation in the finished film, the stills show the enormous white sheets erected behind to throw more favourable light on the stars, while a boom mic hovers overhead just out of shot.
The film tells the story of a brilliant professor who mysteriously dies the night before unveiling a groundbreaking invention: a device that can record and play memories.
Illusion: While it will just look like a normal conversation in the finished film, the stills show the enormous white sheets erected behind to throw more favourable light on the stars, while a boom mic hovers overhead just out of shot.
His wife, played by Home Alone and Beetlejuice mom Catherine O'Hara, discovers the device and uses it, with the help of an 'unlikely friend' - played by Dinklage - to try and get to the bottom of it.
The film is helmed by Mark Palansky, who directed both Dinklage and O'Hara in 2006's Penelope.
That romantic comedy also starred James McAvoy, Reese Witherspoon, Richard E Grant, as well as Christina Ricci as the eponymous Penelope, a girl cursed with a pig's snout.
Plot: The film tells the story of a brilliant professor who mysteriously dies the night before unveiling a groundbreaking invention: a device that can record and play memories
Murder mystery: The inventor's wife, played by Home Alone and Beetlejuice mom Catherine O'Hara, discovers the device and uses it, with the help of an 'unlikely friend' - played by Dinklage - to try and get to the bottom of it
According to IMDb, Palansky has a third project lined up with the Game Of Thrones star - The Jester - while in a 2008 interview with MovieWeb he claimed to have a fourth and fifth in the barrel too.
'I just don't know which one is going to go ahead first,' he said at the time. 'There is one ... called Mendel's Dwarf. It is a scientific love story. That is the best way to put it. It is a really beautiful film.
'Then the second one is called Hop Frog. It is based on a short story by Edgar Allan Poe. It is a dark, dark atmospheric revenge tale. It is really, really great. It is kind of like a Grimm's' Fairytale. It is dark like that. But it isn't really fantastical. It is just more from that time period.'
